artheader.title: Obtaining write access to InterMine source code

sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para: This document details how active developers can obtain InterMine source code from the main CVS server.

sect1.title: Instructions

itemizedlist.listitem: cd to the directory into which you intend to check out the source.
Issue the command cvs -d :ext:cvs-internal.flymine.org/cvs co intermine.
ant -projecthelp gives a list of all the possible build targets.

sect2.title: From outside intermine.org domain
sect2.para: The InterMine main CVS server is on a machine inside the firewall and does not have an external IP address. However, a port on the firewall is set up to forward ssh packets to the cvs server. You will require ssh access to the Intermine system in order to use this machine.

itemizedlist.listitem:
Create a wrapper script as follows: #!/bin/sh
HOST=$1
if [ "$HOST" == "cvs-internal.flymine.org" ] then shift ssh -p 22091 flywall.flymine.org $* else ssh $* fi
Issue the command export CVS_RSH=/path/to/wrapper/script. Put this in your .profile.

sect1.para: Once you have checked out the source from the CVS server, the command cvs update will obtain any updates to the code made by the development team. You should issue this command regularly.
